ovdesc.p: The Commercial Loans and Deposits Module automates the control,
administration, accounting and management information requirements
of both pre and post maturity processing on a Bank's Portfolio.
A wide range of products are catered for and these may be classified
A Commercial Loan An asset product which provides an
extensive range of processing in relation to the
physical extension of credit to a borrower.
A Commercial DepositA liability product which provides an
A Commitment A product type which controls those
instances where a contractual obligation to lend
exists and/or the bank wishes to levy commitment
A Sundry Deposit A miscellaneous item due to a customer.
A Sundry Loan A miscellaneous item due from a customer.
The module has been designed to be as flexible as possible in
managing the various products it covers, and automating as many
functions as one would encounter in the typical Commercial Loans and
It provides a comprehensive set of on-line enquiry facilities,
operational, marketing and management reports which obviate the need
for loan ledger cards and other types of documentation traditionally
The system can if required process a transaction through its life
cycle without any intervention from the user, alternatively, the
user can opt for full manual control.
All processing results in the automatic generation of payments,
billings, chasers, contract/rate amendment documentation etc.
The Bank has full control over the parameters associated with the
life cycle of a transaction eg indicating the number of days after
an event when the transaction is considered to be a past due
obligation. Such parameters are specified in tables which can be
The main features of the module can be described as follows:-
Contracts can be denominated in a currency different from that of the
drawdown or liquidation accounts. Full control is always maintained
in terms of Negotiable, User input or Default Exchange rates
The system processes both Fixed date and Call/Notice type transactions.
Interest bearing and discounted loans and deposits.
Both interest bearing and discounted contracts can be processed.
These can be either single or multiple period transactions.
Five days basis upon which interest/commission will be calculated.
Five days basis currently exist within the system, these are as follows:-
The following interest types are employed offering a wide range of
options for the way in which a bank will structure the interest
Periodic Automatic type Automatic Libor linked
Periodic Manual type manual Libor linked
Periodic Straight type manual libor linked
Automatic or fully manual scheduling facilities for all the financial
components. The scheduling facilities of the system accomodate
either automatic or manual processing for single or multiple period
transactions. Schedules can be defined for each of the following components:-
Margin rates Diary events. Schedules are defined, on the
input date for the appropriate events occuring during a contracts
life. They may be changed individually, or collectively redefined at
any point should the need arise.
The schedule dates can be generated automatically by the system where
they form part of a regular plan or can be input individually by the
user when they result in irregular periods. Any combination of
system generated and user input schedules is allowed.
The user can specify whether the system should automatically
liquidate amounts due on each due date or await user intervention to
A further option exists which allows the liquidation of principal to
be manual while all other components such as interest, commission,
fees etc are automatically processed by the system.
The module caters for the processing of local or withholding tax.
Local tax is computed on any or all of the following components:-
Withholding tax on the other hand is computed solely on the interest
component. The undermentioned four methods are employed and the
system provides comprehensive facilities to track the Banks
liability, the status in relation to outstanding receipts etc.
Full post event and post maturity processing.
Once an event has fallen due the user has the option of manually
controlling the status, or allowing the system to control the status
in accordance with parameters present on certain tables.
Such parameters are specified by the Bank when implementating the
system, they can however be changed at any time.
The sequence of steps followed are as followed:-
Penalty accruals commence on either a financial or
All financial accruals cease. Memorandum accruals continue.
Interest, commission, fees etc, are written off or
capitalised dependending on the Banks implementation decisions.
The principal is written off and the contract is archived.
The Commitment contract controls contractually committed lines and
facilitates the accrual of commitment fees based on the original or
A Commitment can be either revolving or non revolving in nature. A
revolving commitment results in the reinstating of the drawdown
amount once it has been successfully liquidated. A non revolving
Commitment is a reducing entity only.
Automatic production of payment instructions plus all documentation.
Documentation is produced automatically for each and every event
indicated by the user at implementation time; likewise payment
Once generated by the Loans And Deposits Module the records are
handed off to the T24 Delivery System for subsequent processing.
A full range of on-line enquiries and regular reports is provided.
These have been designed to obviate traditional manual recording
systems. These facilities will prove complimentary to back-office
department, account officer, treasurer and the management of the bank.
The on line enquiries available are:-
Overdue Amounts Repayment History Events By

Defines the type of Loan or Deposit contract with respect to
the scheduled payments/repayments.
The contract will be either a BULLET or AMORTising contract.
For a BULLET contract the only events are initial drawdown
and maturity. There are no other scheduled events (apart
from payments linked to the drawdown and maturity). A
contract of this type will be entered using AUTO.SCHEDS set
to YES.
An AMORTising contract has other scheduled events aparat form
initial drawdown and maturity. Other events will be defined
using the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE application, invoked by
DEFINE.SCHEDS set to YES.
A contract may be changed from BULLET to AMORTising, or
vice-versa by changing the definition of the AUTO.SCHEDS and
DEFINE.SCHEDS.fields. Change from AMORT to BULLET requires
an override, overrides are given whenever schedules are redefined.

This field defines the Reimbursement amount of the contract.
This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract.
If an amount of 500 or less is entered, then this is treated
as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field
is updated with the calculated percentage amount (100%
always being the nominal amount).
The reimbursement amount is the amount to be debited/credited
on a loan/ deposit contract at the contract maturity. The
reimbursement price is normally quoted as a percentage of
the nominal, and is usually fixed at input.
Whenever a repayment or principal increase/decrease takes
place, this field is recalculated as a percentage of the
remaining nominal issuing the REIMBURSE.PRICE.
The difference between the REIMBURSE.PRICE and the contract
nominal is posted to profit and loss.

Indicates whether the facility is revolving or non revolving
and also whether the facility is cumulative or not.
If commitments were defined in tranches, facility is provided
to define whether the unused balance of an earlier tranche
may be carried forward to the next tranche or not. If such
carry forward is permitted, then the commitment is deemed to
be of cumulative type.
N = NON REVOLVING
This indicates that Loan will be deducted from the Commitment
Available Amount but repayments will not reinstate the
Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is
non cumulative..
R = REVOLVING This indicates that the Loan will be deducted
from the Commitment Available Amount and any repayments will
reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the
facility is non cumulative.
NC = Commitment facility is non revolving and cumulative.
RC = Commitment facility is revolving and cumulative.

This field is used to amend existing schedules,and/or for the
creation of single new schedules at any one time. This

any one input.

creation of multiple schedules is required, the user should
utilise the DEFINE SCHEDS option as the CHANGE SCHEDS option
is designed for minimal changes only.
Entry of (Y)es will take the user to LMM SCHEDULES LIST which
details all current outstanding schedules for the relevant
contract.The user can utilise the following commands whilst
within the Change Scheds mode:-
"I" Input. This command can be entered
against the appropriate schedule(s) to be amended
and will take the user to the schedule input
screen. It can also be used at the "AWAITING
FUNCTION" prompt where the user will then be requested
to enter the ID which can be either the date of an
existing schedule or a new date when a new
schedule is to be created. Input can be in either
standard or julian date format.
"R" Reverse. This command can be
entered against the appropriate schedule(s) to be
reversed and will take the user to the respective
schedule. It can also be used at the "AWAITING
FUNCTION" prompt where the user will then be requested
to enter the ID of the schedule to be reversed.
Input can be in either standard or julian date format.
"D" Delete. This command is used to
cancel the new schedule created or the amendment
to an existing schedule before it has been authorised.
It can be used by the inputter or authoriser, either against
the appropriate schedule on the LMM SCHEDULE
EXCEPTION list or at the "AWAITING
FUNCTION" prompt where the user will then be
requested to enter the ID of the schedule to be
deleted. Input can be in either standard or julian date format.
"A" Authorise. This command can only be
used at authorisation stage within the normal
constraints of the LOANS & DEPOSITS application.

Indicates if the interest has to be paid in advance or in arrears.
On an interest bearing contract the income or expense accrues
on the face value of the contract. At maturity the value of
the contract will equal the principal value + interest.
On a discounted contract the income or expense is taken at
the start of the transaction. At maturity the value of the
contract will equal the principal value only.
The following values have been defined:
'1' = Interest bearing contracts
For a one period contract, the interest will be
collected/paid on the maturity date. For contracts with
various interest schedules, the interest will be
collected/paid on the scheduled interest dates.
'2' = Discounted basis contracts
The discount deducted in advance is reported as
unearned/unpaid interest. The discount is accrued on a
straightline basis during the life of the contract. For
contracts with various interest schedules the interest will
be collected/paid at the inception of each scheduled
interest period. In this case, if no payment is received,
the user will always liquidate the next discounted interest
due against a receivable account. After final maturity, the
system will automatically change the discounted payment type
to interest bearing payment type.
1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest bearing. 2
= Discounted. (Optional input. Default value = 1)

This field is used to arrive at the penalty spread that will
be calculated when the LD contract becomes PD and crosses
the period specified in PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in the relevant
PD.PARAMETER record. When such period has been exceeded, the
difference between the value in this field and the interest
rate on the underlying contract will form the penalty spread
in the PD record. This rate will be applied on the
outstanding amount in the LD contract (referred to as OP in
PD.AMOUNT.TYPE). For example:
LD Contract amount 1,000,000
First principal payment 100,000
Contract rate 10%
Penalty rate 15%
PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in PD.PARAMETER 2 days
As a result of the above settings, 2 days after the first
principal payment becomes PD (i.e effective the third day),
the penalty spread will be applied at 5% (15%-10%) on the
outstanding LD principal of 900,000.
Once a PD contract is created with the first PD.BALANCE, all
subsequent PD balances will source the (latest) penalty rate
from the PD contract itself (irrespective of PD.PARAMETER setting).
Input in this field is allowed only if LIQUIDATION.MODE

Input is allowed in this field only if CONTRACT.METHOD
and PENALTY.KEY in the relevant PD.PARAMETER is set to NULL
(in other words, input in the PENALTY.RATE field in the
relevant PD.PARAMETER record is mandatory). In such a
case, the value in the PENALTY.RATE in the contract will
take precedence over the value in the PD.PARAMETER record.
Subsequent to the input in this field and authorization
of the LD contract, if the PENALTY.RATE in PD.PARAMETER is
deleted and replaced with a CONTRACT.METHOD setting, then,
when the LD contract becomes overdue, the rate in
PENALTY.RATE in the LD contract is ignored and the
penalty spread (if any) is calculated according to the
CONTRACT.METHOD in PD.PARAMETER

Specifies the rate to be used when Trade Bills are re-discounted.
The bill or bills to be rediscounted are specfied in the
BILL.NUMBER field, the details of each Bill are held in the
BILL.REGISTER application.
In order for a bill to be re-discounted it must first be
discounted. When a bill is re-discounted a profit or loss
will be made on the difference between the discount rate
(held on Bill Register) and the Re-discount rate for the
remaining period of the Bill. A profit is made is of the
Discount rate is greater than the Re-discount rate.
The profit and/or loss for all bills being re-discounted is
recorded in the CHRG.AMNT fields together with a
LMM.CHARGE.CONDITION code in the field CHRG.CODE. The codes
defaulted are held in the field BILL.CHG.CODE in
LMM.INSTALL.CONDS (value 1 is the profit code, value 2 is
the loss code).
The profit or loss for each bill is calculated as:
Bill Amount * (Discount Rate - Re-discount Rate) * No.Days
where Bill Amount and Discount Rate are held on
BILL.REGISTER, and No.Days is the number of days between
Value Date and ,Maturity Date according to the INTEREST.BASIS.
The total amount to be recieved for the rediscount is the sum
of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields. The
DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC is the sum of the value of the original
discount for the remaining term for all bills being
re-discounted. This is calculated for each bill as:
Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No days
where Bill Amount and Discount Rate are held on
BILL.REGISTER, and No.Days is the number of days between
Value Date and ,Maturity Date according to the INTEREST.BASIS.
Optional Rate Field. Only allowed if BILL.NUMBER is entered.

Indicates the type of interest rate to be used for the contract.
The following values are defined for the interest rate type field:
1 = Fixed 2 = Periodic Automatic 3 =
Floating 4 = Periodic Manual 5 =
Periodic Straight
Once authorised this field cannot be changed.
1 = Fixed:
The rate of interest to be charged over the life of the
contract is fixed at a specific percentage and is input as
a numeric value. The rate includes the spread.
2 = Periodic Automatic:
A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates
and become effective on the appropriate revision date.
3 = Floating:
A rate of interest which will change on a non-determined
basis with immediate impact. Input is in the form of a valid
key from the BASIC.RATE.TEXT with the associated rate
defined on BASIC.INTEREST table. A positive or negative
spread rate can be input on the contract.
4 = Periodic Manual
A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates
and become effective on the appropriate rollover date. The
rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision
schedules are mandatory. A positive or negative spread rate
can be input on the contract.
5 = Periodic Straight:
A rate of interest which will not change. The rate is input
in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are
prohibited. A positive or negative spread rate can be input
on the contract.
1 numeric character. Only valid input is 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
(Optional input. Default value = 1 fixed.)

This field indicates the method which will be followed for
the generation of interest and commission schedules as
defined in INTEREST.DUE.DATE and COMM.DUE.DATE fields and
the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non
working day.
The following provides an explanation of the various input
values for this field:
If the derived day is a non working day the system response
will be:
FWD = forward The system will go forward to the next working day.
BWD = backward The system will go backward to the last
working day.
FSM = forward same month The system will go forward to the
next working day provided it is within the same month. If it
is not within the same month the system will go backward to
the last working day.
CAL = Calendar The system will use the same date irrespective
of whether dates cycled are working days or not.

The conversion type, BUY, SELL or MID that is to be used.
Associated with field SETTLEMENT.MARKET. Default conversion
type that is to be used if no input is made in EV.APPL.RATE
in SETTLEMENT.RATES table for the deal.
The settings in this field would govern the exchange rate
derived by the system given the settlement market and the
currencies involved. The conversion type set here is only
reckoned for liquidation during SOD & EOD and not for
online liquidation.
Examples

tr.td: DEM buy rate * GBP mid rate (1.72 * 1.5) = 2.58

desc.p: CONVERSION.TYPE : SELL

tr.td: DEM sell rate * GBP mid rate (1.69 * 1.5) = 2.535

desc.p: CONVERSION.TYPE : MID

tr.td: DEM mid rate* GBP mid rate (1.705 * 1.5) = 2.5575
GBP mid rate* DEM mid rate (1.705 * 1.5) = 2.5575

desc.p: Note : The system would arrive at the cross rate by using the
mid rate of the stronger currency at one end and the
appropriate rate (BUY/SELL) for the other end.

value representing the commission amount defined for the

c) When the user has defined commission schedules this field
will show the commission accrued in the first/current
commission period only.
d) If the commission rate type is "floating" or
there is a commission rate review scheduled in the middle of
the current period, then an estimated amount will be
calculated for the remaining contract life.
e) For commission basis "S" the system will accrue
into P+L based on the rate * principal value * days; the
difference will be compensated for within the final period.
f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be
computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE.
g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts when COMM.DUE.DATE (field 149)
is left blank, this field will be populated with the value
'0' (zero).

Indicates if the commission has to be paid in advance or in
arrears, or if commission is payable by the bank in arrears.
On an interest bearing contract the commission accrues on the
face value of the contract. At maturity the value of the
contract will equal the principal value + interest + commission
On a discounted contract the commission is taken at the start
of the transaction. At maturity the value of the contract
will equal the principal value + interest only.
On a commission payable contract the commission accrues on
the face value of the contract. At maturity, or commission
scheduled payment date, the customer of the loan will be
credited with the commission amount.
The following values have been defined:
'1' = Interest bearing contracts
For a one period contract, the commission will be collected
on the maturity date. For contracts with various commission
schedules, the commission will be collected in arrears on
the scheduled commission maturity dates.
'2' = Discounted basis contracts
The discount deducted in advance is reported as unearned
commission. The discount is accrued on a straightline basis
during the life of the contract.
For contracts with various commission schedules the
commission will be collected at the inception of each
scheduled interest period.
In this case, if no payment is received, the user will always
liquidate the next discounted interest due against a
receivable or transit account.
After final maturity, the system will automatically change
the 'discounted' payment type to 'interest
bearing' payment type.
Discounted contracts will be converted to interest bearing if
principal is outstanding on the maturity/event date. Any
future accruals will be handled on an interest bearing basis
however the current portion will remain on a discounted basis.
Commission Payable Contracts
For a bullet (one period) contract, the commission will be
paid on the maturity date. For contracts with various
commission schedules, the commission will be paid in arrears
on the scheduled commission maturity dates.
1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest
bearing. 2 = Discounted. 3 = Commission
Payable (Optional input. Default = 1)

Field to indicate the currency for which exchange rate is
provided in EXCG.RATE field.
CURRENCY.CODE & EXCG.RATE fields are used to provide the
exchange rates for currencies that are involved at the
drawdown stage. While a loan/deposit is drawn down, the
proceeds may be credited/debited to an account denominated
in another currency. Charges that are collected may have any
currency account for liquidation purposes. In case of
discounted deals, interest and commission may be collected
in advance. In order to define the exchange rates at which
accounting should be handled for all these scenarios, the

Used in Commitment contracts when there are various
commitment interest rates depending on the amount unused.It
states whether the total amount unused is to be charged at a
single rate (level),or whether the amount is split into
several different bands,and each 'band' charged at
a different rate.
Level type
Will charge interest on a 'level' method e.g. :
AMT 1M rate 1/4 % = 0-1M charge 1/4 % AMT 4M rate
1/2 % = 1-4M charge 1/2 % AMT 5M rate 3/4 % =
4-5M charge 3/4 %
So, 3M unused would be charged at 1/2 %, but if 4M is unused,
the whole amount would be charged at 3/4 %.
Banded type
Will charge interest on a banded basis, e.g.:
1M rate 1/4 % = on first 1M charge 1/4 % 4M rate
1/2/% = on next 3M charge 1/2 % 5M rate 3/4 % =
on final 1M charge 3/4 %
e.g. If 4M unused, 1M would be charged at 1/4 %, and 3M
charged at 1/2 %.
Caution : The amounts and their respective rates can be input
in any order, however, the system will take the
largest amount as the Available Commitment Amount.
e.g.:
Field 4.1 2M Field 16.1 10 % Field 4.2
5M Field 16.2 5% Field 4.3 3M
Field 16.3 3% Field 4.4 1M Field 16.4 2%
will be sorted by the system to :
It is recommended that the last amount and rate should be
commitment available amount, and previous amounts/rates
represent sub-limits.

Indicates the Financial charge calculation type.
Four types are permissible, the schedule amount used for
accruals is calculated as follows.
'AN' - Annuity
The current annuity repayment principal amount.
'SL' - Straight Line
(LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) / LIFE
Where LIFE is the number of repayments from the current
repayment date to maturity.
'RB' - Reducing balance
(CURR.PRIN.VALUE LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE)
CURR.PRIN.VALUE is stored on LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES and is
initially LD.PRINCIPAL
RATE is defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and is stored on
SCHED.RATE on LMM.SCHEDULES
DAYS and BASE are set by the Annuity interest basis
This calculation is performed while CURR.PRIN.VALUE
RESIDUAL.VALUE is greater than zero.
'FS' - Flexible schedules
(LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE)
RATE is annual percentage depreciation defined via
LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and the sum of the rates must equal 100
DAYS/BASE is derived from the frequency of the Annuity
schedule e.g. monthly, quarterly etc, normally expressed in
months, i.e. monthly = 1/12.
Optional Input
Input is only allowed if ASSET.REFERENCE is input.
If input must be either 'AN', 'SL',

Holds the total amount to be paid or received for the
discount or rediscount of Trade Bills respectively.
Bills to be discounted/rediscounted are held in the
BILL.NUMBER field, details of each Bill are held in BILL.REGISTER.
For a Discount of Bills this is calculated as:
The sum of Bill Amounts - (Sum of Bill Amounts * Discount
Rate * No Days)
where:
Bill Amount is the amount of an individual Bill held in BILL.REGISTER
Discount Rate is the INTEREST.RATE
No Days is the number of days from the VALUE.DATE to
FIN.MAT.DATE (i.e remaining to Maturity)
For Rediscount of Bills this is calculated as:
The sum of Bill Amounts - (Sum of Bill Amounts * Rediscount
Rate * No Days)
where:
Bill Amount is the amount of an individual Bill held in BILL.REGISTER
Rediscount Rate is the BILL.REDISC.RATE
No Days is the number of days from the VALUE.DATE to
FIN.MAT.DATE (i.e remaining to Maturity)

:LOANS DEPOSITS TESTING LD.SCHEDULE DEFINE 111 : :222
COM:999 : :: :FORWARD.BACKWARD KEY:A1
BASE.DATE KEY:B1 : :SCH DATE AMOUNT/DIARY ACTION RATE
CHRG NO FREQ: :C1 C2 C3 C4 C5
Where the following 9 items are supplied by the system:
111 = Contract number. 222 = Currency mnemonic.
333 = Amount of contract. (or Principal to be re-defined
inclusive of forward dated principal increases) 444
= Start date of contract. 555 = Maturity date of

The following information has to be input by the user:
A1 = forward/backward key where: 1 =
forward 2 = backward
3 = fwd same month 4 = not automatic(default)
When the user wishes the system to generate a series of
schedules automatically this code will indicate the
response if the derived day is a non-working day.
If the derived day is a non working day the system response
will be:
1 = forward The system will go forward to the next working day.
2 = backward The system will go backward to the last working day.
3 = fwd same month The system will go forward to the next
working day provided it is within the same month.
If it is not within the same month the system
will go backward.
4 = not automatic The user must specify each and every event
date. If non-working days are specified the
system will prompt for overrides.
B1 = base date key where: 1 = base
2 = previous 3 = not automatic (default)
This code indicates to the system how the future event dates
are to be computed.
1 = base The system will use the first scheduled date entered
to compute the subsequent event date(s).
2 = previous The system will use the last computed schedule
date in order to compute the subsequent event date.
3 = not automatic The user will enter each and every event
date. This option is only valid if the
forward/backward key = 4 not automatic.

This field can be used to indicate whether yield method of
calculation should be adopted instead of straight discount
method. Valid input to this field is either "YES"
or "NO". If the field is flagged to
"YES", the interest amount would be calculated
under yield method. If flagged to "NO" interest
amount would be calculated under straight discount method.
Under the yield method an Applied Interest Rate would be used
for calculation of the interest amount using the below
mentioned formula;
Applied Interest Rate = (r/100) / (1+(r*nd/100*yd))
r = rate of interest (%)
nd = Number of Days
yd = Number of Days in a year
The following example would illustrate the difference under
straight discount method of interest calculation and yield
method of interest calculation;
Contract Details
Value Date : Jan 01, 2001
Maturity Date : April 01, 2001
Amount : USD 1 Million
Rate of Interest : 10%
Interest Payment Method : Discounted
Interest Basis : A
Under the straight discount method the interest amount
calculated would be USD 25000 for 90 days.
Under the Yield method, the applied interest rate would be
calculated using the above formula which would be 9.7561%.
Based on this applied rate the interest amount calculated
would be USD 24390.24 for 90 days.
The amortisation of interest amount under the yield method
would be at the applied interest rate calculated for each period.
Input allowed only if Int Payment Method is Discounted
Default is "NO"
While inputting a Certificate of Deposit (CD) contract, the
maturity amount of the Deposit should be entered here. Based
on the maturity amount, the tenor, interest capitalisation
(if applicable) and the rate of interest, the initial amount
is calculated by the system and populated in the Amount field.
Once a value is entered in this field, the amount is
calculated using the below mentioned formula:
Amount = Mat.Amount / (1+(r*k/(360*100)))^n
Where
r = rate of interest (%)
n = number of Periods of capitalisation of interest
(In the absence of any I schedule, the contract is treated as
a single period contract)
k = number of days in a period (only A basis permitted)
Examples
Contract 1
Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million
Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a
Value Date = Jan 01, 2001
Maturity Date = April 01, 2001
k = 90 days (A basis)
n = 1 (no I schedules)
Amount = USD 975609.76
Contract 2
Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million
Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a
Value Date = Jan 01, 2001
Maturity Date = April 01, 2001
Interest Capitalisation = Monthly on Feb 01, March 01 &
April 01
k = 30 days (A basis)
n = 3 (no I schedules)
Amount = USD 975410.95
Note that in Contract 2 since interest is capitalised on a
monthly basis the number of days in a period and the number
of periods is different from those in Contract 1.

Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted.
Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER.
In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills
the key should be entered in this field. This will default
the following information:
AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The
DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY
of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The
MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER
consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be
applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are
the same.
DISCOUNT of Bills
Bills can only be discounted when they have first been
ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once
accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED.
When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the
Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be
greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount
rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be
paid. The amount to be paid is:
Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days)
where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the
number of days between value date and maturity date.
A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the
Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using
the following fields:
INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate
RE-DISCOUNT of Bills
Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been
DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince
discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED.
When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in
return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the
maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted
which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount
to be received can be calculated as:
Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days)
Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the
bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount
transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the
original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are
unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss
will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be
realised immediately.
In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is
calculated based on the original discount rate for the
remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the
DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting
ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of
the contract to offset the discount accrual.
The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored
in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details).
The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is
the total amount to be received.
The following fields should be entered for a re-discount:
INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE =
Rediscount Rate

BILL.NUMBER

Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted. Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER. In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills the key should be entered in this field. This will default the following information: AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are the same. DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be discounted when they have first been ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED. When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be paid. The amount to be paid is: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the number of days between value date and maturity date. A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using the following fields: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate RE-DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED. When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount to be received can be calculated as: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days) Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be realised immediately. In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is calculated based on the original discount rate for the remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of the contract to offset the discount accrual. The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details). The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is the total amount to be received. The following fields should be entered for a re-discount: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE = Rediscount Rate
Validation Rules

BILL.REDISC.RATE

Specifies the rate to be used when Trade Bills are re-discounted. The bill or bills to be rediscounted are specfied in the BILL.NUMBER field, the details of each Bill are held in the BILL.REGISTER application. In order for a bill to be re-discounted it must first be discounted. When a bill is re-discounted a profit or loss will be made on the difference between the discount rate (held on Bill Register) and the Re-discount rate for the remaining period of the Bill. A profit is made is of the Discount rate is greater than the Re-discount rate. The profit and/or loss for all bills being re-discounted is recorded in the CHRG.AMNT fields together with a LMM.CHARGE.CONDITION code in the field CHRG.CODE. The codes defaulted are held in the field BILL.CHG.CODE in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS (value 1 is the profit code, value 2 is the loss code). The profit or loss for each bill is calculated as: Bill Amount * (Discount Rate - Re-discount Rate) * No.Days where Bill Amount and Discount Rate are held on BILL.REGISTER, and No.Days is the number of days between Value Date and ,Maturity Date according to the INTEREST.BASIS. The total amount to be recieved for the rediscount is the sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields. The DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC is the sum of the value of the original discount for the remaining term for all bills being re-discounted. This is calculated for each bill as: Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No days where Bill Amount and Discount Rate are held on BILL.REGISTER, and No.Days is the number of days between Value Date and ,Maturity Date according to the INTEREST.BASIS.

YIELD.METHOD

This field can be used to indicate whether yield method of calculation should be adopted instead of straight discount method. Valid input to this field is either "YES" or "NO". If the field is flagged to "YES", the interest amount would be calculated under yield method. If flagged to "NO" interest amount would be calculated under straight discount method. Under the yield method an Applied Interest Rate would be used for calculation of the interest amount using the below mentioned formula; Applied Interest Rate = (r/100) / (1+(r*nd/100*yd)) r = rate of interest (%) nd = Number of Days yd = Number of Days in a year The following example would illustrate the difference under straight discount method of interest calculation and yield method of interest calculation; Contract Details Value Date : Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date : April 01, 2001 Amount : USD 1 Million Rate of Interest : 10% Interest Payment Method : Discounted Interest Basis : A Under the straight discount method the interest amount calculated would be USD 25000 for 90 days. Under the Yield method, the applied interest rate would be calculated using the above formula which would be 9.7561%. Based on this applied rate the interest amount calculated would be USD 24390.24 for 90 days. The amortisation of interest amount under the yield method would be at the applied interest rate calculated for each period.

If the value in this field is set to REPAY.AMT, i t would be possible to collect interest on repayment amount instead of amount accrued so far. Such interest could be collected for scheduled repayments or adhoc repayments. Example : A LD contract is input with the following features: Contract Particulars Value Date 1-Jan-03 Maturity Date 1-May-03 Amount 100000 Interest Rate 10% Interest Basis 366/360 P' Schedules 1-Feb-03 25000 1-Mar-03 25000 1-Apr-03 25000 1-May-03 25000 INT.COLL.METHOD REPAY.AMT For the above contract interest would be calculated and processed on P schedule date. System would calculate the interest liquidation amount as follows; a) On 25000 @ 10% for 31 days (215.28) to be processed on Feb 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. b) On 25000 @ 10% for 59 days (409.72) to be processed on Mar 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. c) On 25000 @ 10% for 90 days (625) to be processed on Apr 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. d) On 25000 @ 10% for 120 days (833.33) to be processed on May 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. Accounting Entries for the above contract would be as under; Cr Customer Account 100000 Dr LIVEDB 100000 Jan 01, 03 - Feb 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 861.11 Dr Accruals 861.11 On Feb 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 215.28 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 215.28 Feb 01, 03 - Mar 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 583.33 Dr Accruals 583.33 On Mar 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 409.72 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 409.72 Mar 01, 03 - Apr 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 430.56 Dr Accruals 430.56 On Apr 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 625 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 625 Apr 01, 03 - May 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 208.33 Dr Accruals 208.33 On May 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 833.33 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 833.33 If an ad-hoc repayment for 10000 were made (using AMOUNT.INCREASE field) on Mar 15, 2003, interest of 202.78 (@ 10% on 10000 for 73 days) would also be collected online along with the repayment amount. Interest amount for subsequent P schedule dates would be recalculated on the redefined schedule amounts. COMM.PAYMT.METHOD

Indicates if the commission has to be paid in advance or in arrears, or if commission is payable by the bank in arrears. On an interest bearing contract the commission accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest + commission On a discounted contract the commission is taken at the start of the transaction. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest only. On a commission payable contract the commission accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity, or commission scheduled payment date, the customer of the loan will be credited with the commission amount. The following values have been defined: '1' = Interest bearing contracts For a one period contract, the commission will be collected on the maturity date. For contracts with various commission schedules, the commission will be collected in arrears on the scheduled commission maturity dates. '2' = Discounted basis contracts The discount deducted in advance is reported as unearned commission. The discount is accrued on a straightline basis during the life of the contract. For contracts with various commission schedules the commission will be collected at the inception of each scheduled interest period. In this case, if no payment is received, the user will always liquidate the next discounted interest due against a receivable or transit account. After final maturity, the system will automatically change the 'discounted' payment type to 'interest bearing' payment type. Discounted contracts will be converted to interest bearing if principal is outstanding on the maturity/event date. Any future accruals will be handled on an interest bearing basis however the current portion will remain on a discounted basis. Commission Payable Contracts For a bullet (one period) contract, the commission will be paid on the maturity date. For contracts with various commission schedules, the commission will be paid in arrears on the scheduled commission maturity dates.
Validation Rules

1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest bearing. 2 = Discounted. 3 = Commission Payable (Optional input. Default = 1) Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Discounted method prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in COMM.RATE. Discounted method prohibited for Commitments. The discounted method is prohibited if Commission Basis "S" is selected.

When PD exists for the contract, asset classification should match the Classification in the corresponding PD contract.

Upon a Commitment reaching its maturity date any unused commitment balance will be reset to zero. If COMMIT.DRAWING is set to NO no drawdowns can be linked. Once a drawdown is linked to a Commitment it will not be possible to reverse the Commitment; it will need to be early matured. Early maturity of this Commitment will require an override. The conversion type, BUY, SELL or MID that is to be used. Associated with field SETTLEMENT.MARKET. Default conversion type that is to be used if no input is made in EV.APPL.RATE in SETTLEMENT.RATES table for the deal. The settings in this field would govern the exchange rate derived by the system given the settlement market and the currencies involved. The conversion type set here is only reckoned for liquidation during SOD & EOD and not for online liquidation. Examples Deal USD Liquidation DEM DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived DEM buy rate = 1.72 Deal GBP Liquidation DEM GBP exchange rate 1.45/1.55 DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived DEM buy rate * GBP mid rate (1.72 * 1.5) = 2.58 Deal DEM Liquidation GBP GBP exchange rate 1.45/1.55 DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived GBP mid rate*DEM sell rate (1.5 * 1.69) = 2.535 CONVERSION.TYPE : SELL Deal USD Liquidation DEM DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived DEM sell rate = 1.69 Deal GBP Liquidation DEM GBP exchange rate 1.45/1.55 DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived DEM sell rate * GBP mid rate (1.69 * 1.5) = 2.535 Deal DEM Liquidation GBP GBP exchange rate 1.45/1.55 DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived GBP mid rate*DEM buy rate (1.5*1.72) = 2.58 CONVERSION.TYPE : MID Deal USD Liquidation DEM DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived DEM mid rate = 1.705 Deal GBP Liquidation DEM GBP exchange rate 1.45/1.55 DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived DEM mid rate* GBP mid rate (1.705 * 1.5) = 2.5575 Deal DEM Liquidation GBP GBP exchange rate 1.45/1.55 DEM exchange 1.72/1.69 Exchange rate derived GBP mid rate* DEM mid rate (1.705 * 1.5) = 2.5575 Note : The system would arrive at the cross rate by using the mid rate of the stronger currency at one end and the appropriate rate (BUY/SELL) for the other end. When a LD schedule is processed, there can be cases when only a portion of the dues get liquidated into the account and the balance written to PD ( USE.AVBL.FUNDS flagged to YES in PD.PARAMETER). If there is user defined rate in SETTLEMENT.RATES file, the entire liquidation (Account & PD) would happen at this rate. Note that in such cases Local Currency Equivalent of the PD created would not be arrived using MID rate.

DEFINE.SCHEDS

If "yes", upon validation the system will automatically take the user to the schedule define screen where interim schedules can be defined manually or semi-automatically. The user will have to specify the scheduled actions which are to occur over the life of the contract. Such actions can include principal, interest, commission, fees, margin revisions, rate revisions or diary actions. The aforementioned actions are not restricted to inception or maturity events. In the case of participating Syndications the values within the schedules represents the users (00) portion only; the syndications portions are computed based on these values and the percentages indicated within the syndication fields of the contract. For Syndications where the user is a non participating agent the values defined within the schedules represent the Syndication as a whole. Upon responding YES to DEFINE SCHEDS and validating the contract the system will take you to the following input screen: :LOANS DEPOSITS TESTING LD.SCHEDULE DEFINE 111 : :222 333 444 555 666 : :777 INT: 888 COM:999 : :: :FORWARD.BACKWARD KEY:A1 BASE.DATE KEY:B1 : :SCH DATE AMOUNT/DIARY ACTION RATE CHRG NO FREQ: :C1 C2 C3 C4 C5 C6 C7: : : : : : : : : :: Where the following 9 items are supplied by the system: 111 = Contract number. 222 = Currency mnemonic. 333 = Amount of contract. (or Principal to be re-defined inclusive of forward dated principal increases) 444 = Start date of contract. 555 = Maturity date of contract. 666 = Payment method and category. 777 = Customer mnemonic. 888 = Interest rate type and interest basis. 999 = Commission rate type and commission calculation method. The following information has to be input by the user: A1 = forward/backward key where: 1 = forward 2 = backward 3 = fwd same month 4 = not automatic(default) When the user wishes the system to generate a series of schedules automatically this code will indicate the response if the derived day is a non-working day. If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: 1 = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. 2 = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. 3 = fwd same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward. 4 = not automatic The user must specify each and every event date. If non-working days are specified the system will prompt for overrides. B1 = base date key where: 1 = base 2 = previous 3 = not automatic (default) This code indicates to the system how the future event dates are to be computed. 1 = base The system will use the first scheduled date entered to compute the subsequent event date(s). 2 = previous The system will use the last computed schedule date in order to compute the subsequent event date. 3 = not automatic The user will enter each and every event date. This option is only valid if the forward/backward key = 4 not automatic. C1 = schedule type i.e. "P" = principal "I" = interest "C" = commission "R" = revision "M" = margin "F" = fees "D" = diary "S" = settlement (system) "A" = advice (system) Not all codes are allowed ie Commitments cannot have principal repayment or margin amendments. Combinations are allowed where the schedule is valid for the components ie principal and interest. C2 = schedule event date ie . DDMMM DDMMMYY DDMMMYYYY DDMMYY DDMMM DDMM YYYYMMDD DD This is the end date of the first period and the starting date for the next/all subsequent events. C3 = amount of schedule or diary narrative. This field indicates the amount of an action or the appropriate diary narrative. An amount can be up to 14 characters plus a decimal point; diary narrative is 35 characters per line. C4 = the revision rate. This relates to the revision rate for either the interest or margin components. C5 = charge code. A valid charge code as defined on the CHARGES table. This field relates to fees and the fee currency will always be in the currency of the contract. C6 = number of scheduled events to occur. This field indicates the number of subsequent scheduled events that are to occur. C7 = frequency of the form nnnD = daily nnnM = monthly nnnQ = Quarterly nnnS = semi annually nnnA = annually with nnn = 1 to 999 and indicates the period between schedule event i.e. 4 D = every four days. Considerations for Syndications. When the user is "AGENT" and a participant the screen definition will relate to the participating agents share (type 00). The remainder of the syndicate detail will be computed based on the percentages indicated on the contract. When the user is "AGENT" and not a participant the screen definition relates to the syndicate definition as a whole (type 99).
Validation Rules

1-3 alphabetic characters of the form: (Y)es or (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) FOR ALL SCHEDULE TYPES Schedule definition prohibited for Accounts Receivable, Sundries, Call and Notice Contracts. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate type. Schedule definition prohibited if the value in AUTO SCHEDS = (Y)es. If unauthorised schedules exist, then input to DEFINE SCHEDS is prohibited. Changing from DEFINE SCHEDS to AUTO SCHEDS is prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC and PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate types. A valid date is mandatory for each schedule type. If a date is input it must be a valid date format. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date, as defined on the HOLIDAY table, is a non-working day. Input prohibited for dates prior to the value in the Field VALUE.DATE. Input prohibited for dates later than the value in the Field FIN.MAT.DATE. If an amount is input it must be a valid amount format. If a schedule type is input this must be of the form P, I, C, M, D, F, or R, or a valid combination of up to three i.e. PIC. Schedules can only be defined for dates greater than the system dates except for I + C schedules when the system date equals the value date. If re-definition is specified input must be one of the following values P I R C M F D or ALL. If interest basis "S" is used both the "FORWARD/BACKWARD KEY" and the "BASE DATE KEY" must be set to "NOT AUTOMATIC. Define schedules prohibited for overnight Contracts of all Category types. DELIVERY.INFO

The production of advices in LD is controlled by the LMM.ADVICES application, where the advice format required can be set for all advices, or by application and/or Format Category code. Standard delivery messages are set up in the DE.MESSAGE application and are mapped by the DE.MAPPING application and output via the various DE.FORMAT applications. When the handoff record is created it contains several sections which contain images of the underlying contracts as well as additional information. The layout of the handoff record is as follows: Record 1 contains the Default Delivery from MESSAGE.CONTROL when used Record 2 contains the underlying LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS contract in most cases For some advices this is replaced by a payment details record like PAYMENT.ENTRY During overnight processing an account balances record is passed instead Record 3 contains additional information depending on the contract activity Overnight schedule details are passed in this record Record 4 Only ever contains additional information for special advices Record 5 Contains schedule details for redefined schedules Record 6 contains a copy of the contract, usually formatted for Swift Record 7 is an additional schedule array built from LMM.SCHEDULE.DATES and LMM.SCHEDULES The layout is as follows: In the case of changes made for the use of the Amount.Increase field, the following fields are used: 7.25 Original amount of the contract 7.26 Contract interest rate 7.27 Contract value date 7.28 Contract final maturity date 7.29 Contract total interest amount 7.30 Signed principal amount for this schedule In the case of a Deposit, an increase is positive, a decrease is negative In the case of a Loan, an increase is negative, a decrease is positive 7.31 Date of amendment Record 8 contains Rollover details where appropriate Record 9 is not use.

INT.RATE.TYPE

Indicates the type of interest rate to be used for the contract. The following values are defined for the interest rate type field: 1 = Fixed 2 = Periodic Automatic 3 = Floating 4 = Periodic Manual 5 = Periodic Straight Once authorised this field cannot be changed. 1 = Fixed: The rate of interest to be charged over the life of the contract is fixed at a specific percentage and is input as a numeric value. The rate includes the spread. 2 = Periodic Automatic: A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate revision date. 3 = Floating: A rate of interest which will change on a non-determined basis with immediate impact. Input is in the form of a valid key from the BASIC.RATE.TEXT with the associated rate defined on BASIC.INTEREST table. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 4 = Periodic Manual A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate rollover date. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are mandatory. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 5 = Periodic Straight: A rate of interest which will not change. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are prohibited. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract.

For 3 = Floating rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input in the interest rate field is prohibited. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Change of rates will be done via the BASIC.INTEREST table. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments, deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 4 = Periodic Manual rate type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for Commitments, Sundry and Accounts Receivable. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Change of rates will be done via revision schedules. - Prohibited for call and notice contracts. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments. FIN.CHG.CALC.TYPE

Indicates the Financial charge calculation type. Four types are permissible, the schedule amount used for accruals is calculated as follows. 'AN' - Annuity The current annuity repayment principal amount. 'SL' - Straight Line (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) / LIFE Where LIFE is the number of repayments from the current repayment date to maturity. 'RB' - Reducing balance (CURR.PRIN.VALUE LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) CURR.PRIN.VALUE is stored on LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES and is initially LD.PRINCIPAL RATE is defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and is stored on SCHED.RATE on LMM.SCHEDULES DAYS and BASE are set by the Annuity interest basis This calculation is performed while CURR.PRIN.VALUE RESIDUAL.VALUE is greater than zero. 'FS' - Flexible schedules (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) RATE is annual percentage depreciation defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and the sum of the rates must equal 100 DAYS/BASE is derived from the frequency of the Annuity schedule e.g. monthly, quarterly etc, normally expressed in months, i.e. monthly = 1/12.

MAT.AMOUNT

While inputting a Certificate of Deposit (CD) contract, the maturity amount of the Deposit should be entered here. Based on the maturity amount, the tenor, interest capitalisation (if applicable) and the rate of interest, the initial amount is calculated by the system and populated in the Amount field. Once a value is entered in this field, the amount is calculated using the below mentioned formula: Amount = Mat.Amount / (1+(r*k/(360*100)))^n Where r = rate of interest (%) n = number of Periods of capitalisation of interest (In the absence of any I schedule, the contract is treated as a single period contract) k = number of days in a period (only A basis permitted) Examples Contract 1 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 k = 90 days (A basis) n = 1 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975609.76 Contract 2 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 Interest Capitalisation = Monthly on Feb 01, March 01 & April 01 k = 30 days (A basis) n = 3 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975410.95 Note that in Contract 2 since interest is capitalised on a monthly basis the number of days in a period and the number of periods is different from those in Contract 1.

Used in Commitment contracts when there are various commitment interest rates depending on the amount unused.It states whether the total amount unused is to be charged at a single rate (level),or whether the amount is split into several different bands,and each 'band' charged at a different rate. Level type Will charge interest on a 'level' method e.g. : AMT 1M rate 1/4 % = 0-1M charge 1/4 % AMT 4M rate 1/2 % = 1-4M charge 1/2 % AMT 5M rate 3/4 % = 4-5M charge 3/4 % So, 3M unused would be charged at 1/2 %, but if 4M is unused, the whole amount would be charged at 3/4 %. Banded type Will charge interest on a banded basis, e.g.: 1M rate 1/4 % = on first 1M charge 1/4 % 4M rate 1/2/% = on next 3M charge 1/2 % 5M rate 3/4 % = on final 1M charge 3/4 % e.g. If 4M unused, 1M would be charged at 1/4 %, and 3M charged at 1/2 %. Caution : The amounts and their respective rates can be input in any order, however, the system will take the largest amount as the Available Commitment Amount. e.g.: Field 4.1 2M Field 16.1 10 % Field 4.2 5M Field 16.2 5% Field 4.3 3M Field 16.3 3% Field 4.4 1M Field 16.4 2% will be sorted by the system to : 4.4 16.4 4.1 16.1 4.3 16.3 4.2 16.2 It is recommended that the last amount and rate should be commitment available amount, and previous amounts/rates represent sub-limits.

The Commercial Loans and Deposits Module automates the control, administration, accounting and management information requirements of both pre and post maturity processing on a Bank's Portfolio. A wide range of products are catered for and these may be classified into five generic groups:- A Commercial Loan An asset product which provides an extensive range of processing in relation to the physical extension of credit to a borrower. A Commercial DepositA liability product which provides an extensive range of processing facilities. A Commitment A product type which controls those instances where a contractual obligation to lend exists and/or the bank wishes to levy commitment fees based on usage etc. A Sundry Deposit A miscellaneous item due to a customer. A Sundry Loan A miscellaneous item due from a customer. The module has been designed to be as flexible as possible in managing the various products it covers, and automating as many functions as one would encounter in the typical Commercial Loans and Deposits Department of a Bank. It provides a comprehensive set of on-line enquiry facilities, operational, marketing and management reports which obviate the need for loan ledger cards and other types of documentation traditionally maintained manually. The system can if required process a transaction through its life cycle without any intervention from the user, alternatively, the user can opt for full manual control. All processing results in the automatic generation of payments, billings, chasers, contract/rate amendment documentation etc. The Bank has full control over the parameters associated with the life cycle of a transaction eg indicating the number of days after an event when the transaction is considered to be a past due obligation. Such parameters are specified in tables which can be amended at any time. The main features of the module can be described as follows:- Multi-Currency drawdown or liquidation. Contracts can be denominated in a currency different from that of the drawdown or liquidation accounts. Full control is always maintained in terms of Negotiable, User input or Default Exchange rates applicable to the transaction. Fixed Maturity and Call/Notice. The system processes both Fixed date and Call/Notice type transactions. Interest bearing and discounted loans and deposits. Both interest bearing and discounted contracts can be processed. These can be either single or multiple period transactions. Five days basis upon which interest/commission will be calculated. Five days basis currently exist within the system, these are as follows:- 360/360 366/360 360/365 366/365 Special basis. Five different interest types. The following interest types are employed offering a wide range of options for the way in which a bank will structure the interest component on a transaction:- Fixed Floating Base rate linked Periodic Automatic type Automatic Libor linked Periodic Manual type manual Libor linked Periodic Straight type manual libor linked Automatic or fully manual scheduling facilities for all the financial components. The scheduling facilities of the system accomodate either automatic or manual processing for single or multiple period transactions. Schedules can be defined for each of the following components:- Principal repayments Interest payments Commission payments Fee collections Revision rates Margin rates Diary events. Schedules are defined, on the input date for the appropriate events occuring during a contracts life. They may be changed individually, or collectively redefined at any point should the need arise. The schedule dates can be generated automatically by the system where they form part of a regular plan or can be input individually by the user when they result in irregular periods. Any combination of system generated and user input schedules is allowed. Automatic or manual liquidation facilities. The user can specify whether the system should automatically liquidate amounts due on each due date or await user intervention to manually effect the process. A further option exists which allows the liquidation of principal to be manual while all other components such as interest, commission, fees etc are automatically processed by the system. Local and Withholding Taxation. The module caters for the processing of local or withholding tax. Local tax is computed on any or all of the following components:- Principal Interest Commission Withholding tax on the other hand is computed solely on the interest component. The undermentioned four methods are employed and the system provides comprehensive facilities to track the Banks liability, the status in relation to outstanding receipts etc. "CN" Customer Net "CG" Customer Gross "BN" Bank Net "BG" Bank Gross Full post event and post maturity processing. Once an event has fallen due the user has the option of manually controlling the status, or allowing the system to control the status in accordance with parameters present on certain tables. Such parameters are specified by the Bank when implementating the system, they can however be changed at any time. The sequence of steps followed are as followed:- PAST DUE OBLIGATION "PDO" STATUS. Penalty accruals commence on either a financial or memorandum basis. NON ACCRUAL BASIS "NAB" STATUS. All financial accruals cease. Memorandum accruals continue. Interest, commission, fees etc, are written off or capitalised dependending on the Banks implementation decisions. WRITE OFF "WOF" STATUS. The principal is written off and the contract is archived. Revolving and non revolving Commitments. The Commitment contract controls contractually committed lines and facilitates the accrual of commitment fees based on the original or unused amount of the contract. A Commitment can be either revolving or non revolving in nature. A revolving commitment results in the reinstating of the drawdown amount once it has been successfully liquidated. A non revolving Commitment is a reducing entity only. Automatic production of payment instructions plus all documentation. Documentation is produced automatically for each and every event indicated by the user at implementation time; likewise payment instructions are generated when appropriate. Once generated by the Loans And Deposits Module the records are handed off to the T24 Delivery System for subsequent processing. Comprehensive enquiry and reporting facilities. A full range of on-line enquiries and regular reports is provided. These have been designed to obviate traditional manual recording systems. These facilities will prove complimentary to back-office department, account officer, treasurer and the management of the bank. Internal I-Descriptor
This field will hold a valid ID of EB.ACCRUAL.PARAM for the interest / commission / accrual calculations.
Based on the definition of this field a contract can be configured to do the following,
Include first day of the interest period and exclude the last of the interest period
Exclude the first day of the interest period and include the last of the interest period.
Include both first (only value date) and last day of accrual period.
Adjust the principal increase and decrease effective dates for interest calculation and accrual calculation purposes.
By default the field shall hold null in which case the system shall include first day of the interest period and exclude the last of the interest period.
This would be a NOCHANGE field after authorization.
Indicates a special conversion rate to be utilised in the
conversion to local currency of the month-end interest and
commission accruals.
Monthly Profit and Loss accruals will be computed for
reporting purposes using this rate instead of taking the
CURRENCY table middle rate.
This rate will be applicable during the current status only
of the contract. For penalty interest, the system will not
consider the value of this field but instead take the middle
rate as defined in the CURRENCY table.
The accruals will still be computed and held in the contract currency.
Changes can be effected at any time during the life of the
contract, but will impact future accruals only.
1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point of the form:
999999.9999 (Optional input)
An override will be required if the value in this field is
outside the tolerance indicated on the CURRENCY table.
Input must not exceed a tolerance of 25%.
Input in this field is allowed only if the currency of the
contract is different from local currency.
Input must be a positive value.
